comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: news.google.com/newspapers?id=yexUAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JpIDA... here's a link to a 1923 Sydney Mail short story about an 18 footer championship...which I'll park here for want of a better spot...it's a pretty good spot actually(!)...as can be seen from the names of the yachts mentioned in the story, the author has borrowed from life...During the 1920s the Sydney Mail featured quite a few nautical and yachting stories, most of them written by local authors (in this case I suspect the author was Clarrie Faulkner, an earlier 20th century SMH, Telegraph and Evening Snooze journalist...later in life he was a North Sydney alderman, etc...but my hunch re the author's identity is a bit of a guess...maybe if Clarrie Faulkner's name came up on yacht club membership lists this might add a few bricks to my theory). news.google.com/newspapers?id=hFwRAAAAIBAJ&sjid=IZYDA... - another one! news.google.com/newspapers?id=tbcoAAAAIBAJ&sjid=KJIDA... this feature article on Sydney's 18 footers would have us believe they were 'the marvel of the sailing world' (!) ...a few pages earlier news.google.com/newspapers?id=tbcoAAAAIBAJ&sjid=KJIDA...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] How fabulous, I loved 'Mug of the Murrumbidgee'. We've tucked these links away on the not-so-unlikely chance that the images used are somewhere in our collection too! Thanks!
